image.altText: A group of men wearing black.

props.synopsis: The attack on Aboriginal protest site Camp Sovereignty is just the latest attack on First Nations sites and people. Indigenous leaders want it declared an act of terror.

title.children: Calls for attack on Aboriginal site to be declared hate crime

image.altText: Jacinta Allan

props.synopsis: A press conference held by Premier Jacinta Allan was cut short when Neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell interrupted the event to make false claims about protest rights.

title.children: Neo-Nazi gatecrashes press conference with Victorian premier

image.altText: Rowland stands in the prime minister's courtyard smiling.

props.synopsis: A new proposal would introduce a fee for Freedom of Information requests and tighten the rules around the release of documents related to government deliberations.

title.children: Labor plans to make it harder to access government information

image.altText: A couple stand in front of the Grand Canyon

props.synopsis: A new administrator's report has revealed Traveldream paid another company to secure flights, accommodation and tours for customers, which has now gone into administration itself.

title.children: Travellers face heavy losses after agency and supplier go under

image.altText: An image showing a middle-aged man staring down the barrel of the camera.

props.synopsis: A week on from a shooting in Victoria's north east that killed two police officers, the alleged gunman remains on the run.

title.children: Police reviewing 'remarkable' amount of new Dezi Freeman information

image.altText: A large room is full of household items with a man in a helmet taking a photo with his phone of it

props.synopsis: After protests turned violent over MP perks in Indonesia, mobs looted the homes of four suspended parliamentarians, stealing some luxury items while destroying others including sports cars.

title.children: Looters ransack Indonesian MPs' houses, taking luxury watches, bags and even cats

image.altText: Surfer Molly Picklum sitting on her board in the water before a surfing heat

props.synopsis: Molly Picklum is Australia's newest world champion after storming to victory in the World Surf League Finals in Fiji.

title.children: Molly Picklum becomes surfing world champion, wins WSL finals in Fiji

image.altText: A bald man in a blue suit, white shirt and blue tie walks along a street with tv cameras surrounding him.

props.synopsis: Notorious drug kingpin Tony Mokbel smiles at reporters as he arrives at Victoria's Court of Appeal where he is seeking to overturn drug trafficking convictions from two decades ago.

title.children: Tony Mokbel's appeal begins with former prosecutor in crosshairs

image.altText: A man in a suit stands holding up a newspaper.

props.synopsis: Shadow Attorney-General Julian Leeser has labelled the government's plans to charge for access to Freedom of Information documents a "transparency tax". Follow live.

title.children: Coalition says plan for information access charges a 'transparency tax'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Crackdown on AI deep-fake pornography apps a 'line in sand'
PM says not everyone who attended anti-immigration protests were neo-Nazis
Neo-Nazi's gatecrashing of Victorian premier's press conference 'horrific': PM

image.altText: Rudy Giuliani wearing a blue suit and tie and clear-framed glasses mid-speech, with his teeth showing.

props.synopsis: The decision awards the United States' Presidential Medal of Freedom to a man once lauded for leading New York after the 2001 September 11 attacks, and later sanctioned by courts for amplifying false election claims.

title.children: Trump to award Rudy Giuliani the highest US civilian order

image.altText: A young white man in an orange cap and matching racing suit smiles and makes a 'number one' gesture with his right hand

props.synopsis: Formula 1 is having a moment — and so is Oscar Piastri, the Australian driver who is currently topping the leaderboard. As the race to the championship heats up, now is the perfect time to get up to speed.

title.children: Your guide to Formula 1 and Oscar Piastri as the championship race heats up

image.altText: US Securities and Exchange Commission

props.synopsis: The US president has taken another step in his unrelenting campaign to undermine the US Federal Reserve's credibility and install loyalists to the board to deliver him control of US, and by default, global interest rates.

title.children: As Australia's corporate cop gets its act together, US comes undone

image.altText: The reception area of an office building, with a white counter inscribed with Queensland Fertility Group.

props.synopsis: For couples undergoing IVF, there is a need to know where the donor sperm came from, but at this fertility giant, there was a 99 per cent chance the sperm was labelled incorrectly.

title.children: IVF giant ignored warnings it was at 'high risk' of sperm donor mix-ups

image.altText: A young boy crying next to three women sitting in outside next to a brick wall.

props.synopsis: The International Association of Genocide Scholars says signatories to the genocide convention, including Australia, should prevent arms sales to Israel and uphold international law.

title.children: Leading scholars say Israel committing genocide in Gaza

image.altText: A woman and two young girls lay on a mat outside, with two girls crying

props.synopsis: The Taliban has joined locals in calling for international help to rescue those caught up in an earthquake that has killed at least 800 people and injured thousands of others.

title.children: Earthquake survivors say children remain trapped as Taliban calls for help

image.altText: ASX board with stock names and prices blurred as board moves

props.synopsis: The ASX at record highs is 'overvalued', according to market analysts, who say investors are paying too much for shares, considering some of Australia's largest companies revealed underwhelming profits during the August reporting season.

title.children: Share prices go wild while earnings have 'basically done nothing'

image.altText: Princess Diana in a rain poncho sitting next to John Major in black glasses and Prince Charles with a towel around his neck

props.synopsis: From detailing Princess Diana's secret counselling sessions with the queen's favourite PM, to meddling in Australia's biggest political scandal, this new book lays bare the relationship between Crown and State

title.children: As her marriage collapsed, this surprising PM became Princess Diana's closest confidant

image.altText: a teenage boy looks at the camera wearing a cap and headphone. His mum stands at his side smiling at him lovingly.

props.synopsis: Special assistance schools are experiencing growing demand as traditional classrooms fall short of meeting the needs of neurodivergent students.

title.children: Neurodivergent students exit mainstream in droves amid school refusal crisis

image.altText: Gold bars piled on a wooden pallet.

props.synopsis: Local stocks have fallen at the open, as markets await key US economic data and Australian growth figures due this week. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Gold price near all-time highs while ASX slips

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Permanent migration program set for 2025-26 at 185,000 places
ANZ-Roy Morgan consumer confidence ticks up
Bessent expects court to uphold Trump's tariffs but eyes Plan B

image.altText: Boxes of toys stacked into a small mountain inside a shed

props.synopsis: A man has been arrested for allegedly stealing $250,000 worth of Lego and toys from department stores across Adelaide in a bid to resell them online, police say.

title.children: Lego and toys worth $250,000 allegedly stolen from Adelaide stores

image.altText: Aerial shot of large ship leaving port.

props.synopsis: Options for the new Spirit of Tasmania ship to "ease the housing crisis" in Scotland or accommodate "displaced residents" in California were passed over in favour of it being docked at a cost to Tasmanian taxpayers of around $600,000 a month, documents reveal.

title.children: Plan to use Tasmanian ferry to house 'displaced residents' in US revealed

image.altText: Ben Griscti

props.synopsis: NBL player Ben Griscti fractured a vertebra after a backboard collapsed on him during training, before waiting more than 90 minutes for an ambulance to take him to a nearby hospital.

title.children: 90-minute wait for ambulance after backboard collapses on basketballer

image.altText: Composite image of Piotr Szczerek taking a cap from a young fan at the US Open.

props.synopsis: Piotr Szczerek apologises after footage of the Polish businessman stealing a US Open player's cap from the young fan it was intended for goes viral.

title.children: Polish CEO apologises for stealing cap from young US Open fan

image.altText: Cricketer Pat Cummins off the field, ready to start play, wearing whites and a green cap

props.synopsis: Pat Cummins is no certainty to captain Australia in the first Ashes Test as he deals with stress in his back.

title.children: Fitness cloud over captain Cummins ahead of upcoming Ashes series

image.altText: Joe Bugner wearing a green boxing championship belt and smiling while pointing upwards with two fingers and smiling

props.synopsis: At his peak, the Hungarian-born boxer who lived more than half his life on the Gold Coast won the Australian, British, European and Commonwealth belts and twice fought Muhammad Ali.

title.children: Former boxing champ 'Aussie' Joe Bugner, who fought Muhammad Ali, dies

image.altText: Man sits in garden on deck

props.synopsis: A year on from the landmark Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide, ADF members say cultural issues have not been addressed.

title.children: ADF member feels like he has been 'treated like a problem' after DV attack

image.altText: Anne Ruston in the Senate.

props.synopsis: The Coalition, Greens and independent senator David Pocock team up to pressure the government to bring forward 20,000 home support packages, after the government's promised release of 83,000 was pushed back from July to November.

title.children: Labor faces Senate showdown over home supports for older Australians

image.altText: A man smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Journalists in Australia are among dozens of reporters who fear for their lives and those of family members after receiving death threats from the Iranian regime.

title.children: Iran threats spark fear that journalists 'could die on the streets of Melbourne'

image.altText: A large concrete office building with glass windows on a cloudy day, with Alcoa written in large letters.

props.synopsis: US aluminium giant Alcoa made inaccurate or misleading claims in an advertisement about its rehabilitation of the forests it mines in, Australia's advertising watchdog finds.

title.children: Watchdog rules Alcoa claims about jarrah forest rehabilitation not true

image.altText: A mother and her four adult children, one in a chair, are grouped together in front of Christmas trees.

props.synopsis: Emma Trenerry's family, community and footy club have raised tens of thousands of dollars to buy the terminally ill 32-year-old more time with her kids.

title.children: Mother's heartbreaking mission to buy more time for her dying daughter

image.altText: A blonde, middle-aged woman wearing a purple jacket speaks into a mic

props.synopsis: A suspected Russian interference attack disabled GPS navigation services at a Bulgarian airport impacting a plane carrying European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen, according to Britain's Financial Times.

title.children: EU chief Ursula von der Leyen's plane hit by alleged Russian GPS interference

image.altText: A close-up of a man with dark hair and blue eyes.

props.synopsis: After a month-long trial, Matt Wright was last week found guilty on two counts of attempting to pervert the course of justice by a Supreme Court jury. So, what's next in the case of the celebrity crocodile wrangler?

title.children: Found guilty of hindering chopper crash probe, what's next for Matt Wright?

image.altText: A young teenage boy lying in a hospital bed wearing a red team shirt.

props.synopsis: Two years ago, Ollie Miles never thought he would play footy again after being diagnosed with a rare and aggressive form of cancer. On the weekend, he kicked the final goal in his team's grand final win.

title.children: Teen celebrates emotional grand final win after beating leukaemia

image.altText: People in the streets of Sydney on a wintery day all rugged up

props.synopsis: The general sentiment that Australia just shivered through a cold winter is false —although it wasn't as warm as forecasts predicted pre-season.

title.children: Was Australia's winter actually colder than normal?

image.altText: A man stands in front of a painting, smiling.

props.synopsis: Plans for a $50 million art gallery in western Victoria spark debate over class divides and how council money should be spent.

title.children: Out of touch or for everyone? Council faces ire over costly art gallery
